attributes.action: Make it law for cyclists to have appropriate vehicle insurance and road tax
attributes.additional_details:
Cyclists using the highways should be governed by the same vehicle insurance and road tax laws as all other vehicles in the event an accident occurs. 
In the event a cyclists hits another vehicle and the cyclist is at fault, why should the driver of the motorvehicle have to claim against his/her insurance policy and incur inflated premiums upon renewal of their policy. 
This has been a grey area for years that needs a significant overhaul
attributes.background:
A cyclist crashed in to my vehcile causing over £10k worth of damage to my car.
As the cyclist didn't have vehcle insurance I was unable to claim from the other party meaning my insurance premiums have gone through the roof and I was deemed 'at fault' despite the fact the cyclist crashed in to me.
